item.title: Motion
item.description: Chasing trees and outwardly Sensing a passing of clutter, You glimpse a frame of time Through this whirling globe. A fairground ride wouldn’t be Unlike this spinning cycle - All heads turned together As if linked by some Unthought of singularity. The pausing of a face frozen With a smile; An arm outstretched, Tracing an arc through the night sky. Everything moves: motion is energy. 2011

item.title: Legs Eleven
item.description: I, the spindly-legged man, wonder wistfully whether There’ll ever be a time of outward growth. A thin man, me, to most I look like a spider â€“ I think myself to be more like a greyhound or A stripped-down rally car. All mind and muscle, I have neither room for fat Nor time to sit. 2007

item.title: Entrance of Spring
item.description: Fleeting glimpses of pale skies grey your eyes; Your motion carries merely still-frames, Snatched through intervals of vision. As you wander the cold gaps of dormant life, Your sense of belonging to the transition And its apathetic cycle draws you into seclusion. When the bold colours hammer their signature, You are the moment’s contrast in an opening scene, Soon to be captured by a riot of drama. The unfurled banner of natural influence

item.title: Cosmic Trigger
item.description: Staring star-faced into the black sky at night You see the pure white pinpricks of light, Far superior to Hollywood glitter. It’s as if a rapid-fire gun in the sky has Randomly holed the black sheet of the universe To reveal a surprise. 2007

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A calamitous life, Carry a knife, Trouble and strife. Old age will come without a gun Though the fight for space is not without Struggle. Make more money; haggle; be abused by Shopkeepers. Life is a Tupperware party: All plastic and empty vacuums. 2004

item.title: (Spirit)uality
item.description: Wicked whiskey, like Cocaine, creeps Inside without knocking. Slowly, you begin to Feel its heat thread Through you; feel its Insidious grip… 2004

item.title: Deathtrap Boxes
item.description: Cars and commuting induce Hatred of other prisoners Of mobile sealed-off Containers of death. We’re all driven by a tendency To compete: Hey, I bet I can beat you, You, in the BMW. Driverholics out there, Spare a thought for the Synthetic nature of your situation: You add to a nation’s sense of alienation. 2004

item.title: Car Boot Sale
item.description: Two plastic eggs One stainless steel cutlery set (stained) A pair of wicker chairs Four candles A collection of happy songs Countless doubters Some hardwired selfishness One camera obscura Several dark horses (guilt-ridden) Bucketfuls of sobriety A cauldron (one careful owner) Some money (spent) An old hat stand 32,850 days 4,680 weeks One life (lived) 2007
